Reviews.Title: “Absolutely rubbish”
Reviews.Author: tig s
Reviews.Content: On booking the Hotel we requested a non smoking room, on our arrival at the Hotel we were met by a very scruffy person at the reception desk. The person made absolutely no communication with us and it was even necessary for us to ask him where the room was. The room we were given was 115 and on opening the door we were immediately struck by the strong and disgusting odour of stale cigarette smoke. We noticed that there was cigarette burns on just about everything in the room. The deco was in the worst state I have ever seen at a Hotel, the carpet was worn, frayed and dirty. The place was far from clean. The smoke alarm cover was missing, as no doubt, someone had removed the battery in order to smoke. The bin in the room was in a disgusting state and the coffee machine was unusable due to its state. There were burn marks on the bathroom cabinets and the whole place was absolutely disgusting. The only reason we did not walk out was that we had been travelling for some 20 hours without sleep and very little to eat, we did not know the area and had no transport to go elsewhere. Because the place felt unsafe we found it necessary to put furniture in front of the door. With very little sleep, we could not get out quick enough. We did not see anything for breakfast nor did the person at reception offer us any. Without doubt this is by far the most disgusting Hotel I have ever been unfortunate enough to have to stay at. The only people that will give this a good review will be idiots!

Reviews.Title: “Close to Airport”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a cheaprooms.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel was great if you are arriving in Phoenix late at night or leaving early in the morning.....staff was very nice and accommodating...pick-up at AP was super quick as was return....would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible experience”
Reviews.Author: Tracy W
Reviews.Content: On 03/31/12, my friend and i checked in at this hotel. When we first walked in the room we were greeted by squeaks from the floor, the room had a musty odor and the room was outdated. The first night we had to fight of some type of small black flying bugs. The second night the bugs got worst. The entire bathroom was infested with them. We complained and asked for our money back. The manager, Mr. Andy refused to give us a refund for one day and said that the bugs were ants. I know the difference between ants and flying little black bugs. The next day I attempted to contact Mr. Andy to discuss my experience at the hotel and getting a refund for one night however, he refused to speak with me and hung up the telephone in my face several times. I would not recommend anyone to patronIze this hotel due to the unprofessional Manager and dirty bug infested rooms.

Reviews.Title: “A practical stop off when using the airport”
Reviews.Author: sjk129
Reviews.Content: Practical 1 night stay for each night pre and post flight travel. Good points - location, transport to/from airport, shower Not so good points - noisy fridge (is this required in every room?), outside staircase walk whch may also be noisy when guests leave and arrive. We were initially directed to a room that hadn't been prepared, so having to take our cases back and forth after a long wasn't ideal. We were soon sorted with another room though. I hadn't realised from the website that this is a motel style accomodation, but the location is good for transport to the airport. Breakfast is served in disposable plates and crockery - I suppose better than nothing if you're in a rush. The shower was super, just what's needed after a long flight.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay - Close to Airport”
Reviews.Author: Ann F
Reviews.Content: The room was large and comfortable, and the staff friendly and helpful. The shuttle to the airport was incredibly quick to pick us up, and this hotel is only minutes from the airport. We had an early morning flight, no problem! Breakfast started at 5:30.

Reviews.Title: “Parking Experience”
Reviews.Author: Patti C
Reviews.Content: We left our car at the hotel during a 6-day trip to Schenectady, NY in November 2011. The shuttle picked us up in front of the hotel, then at the airport upon our return. The price was excellent. It was a very pleasant experience, one we will take advantage of again.

Reviews.Title: “Bad, bad idea”
Reviews.Author: Crystal S
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here our last night in Phoenix and it was an awful experience. It was very musky and outdated. The television worked after my boyfriend was instructed by the manager to "beat on it a few times," the floors creaked under us like they were improperly replaced, my card was charged twice the amount of the stay, PLUS we may have gotten bed bug bites from this hotel, the Howard Johnson in Williams AZ, OR the Rodeway Inn in Page, AZ (none of which I would recommend considering). My recommendation is to spend a little more and stay somewhere nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: greg a
Reviews.Content: I was in Phoenix on business. This is a great property, convenient to Downtown and the Airport. It was clean and quiet and the staff are very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Looked Shady, pleasant Stay.”
Reviews.Author: ZGG_PR
Reviews.Content: Very close to the airport. Free Airport Shuttle. Free WiFi. Included continental breakfast which included fruits, waffles, cereal, toast, bagel-good, from 5:30-10am. Clean Rooms with very comfortable beds and pillows. Very rough but clean towels. Hot and good shower pressure. Good Room Cleaning Service. The only thing I did not like about this Hotel was that it was in a shady area of town and it looked unsafe, however we did not encounter any vandalism. All of the rooms are in the exterior which I also did not like--you open the door of your room and you were outside. Staff was very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “A good park/stay/fly hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Eagle1623
Reviews.Content: Very reasonable, older style motel two story outside entrances but clean, quiet and close to the airport. Contact direct to save money next time rather than booking through a service like Stay123. Bed was very comfortable, no flat screen tv but what was there was adequate. Hotel manager was very efficient and conscientious. I would stay there again as it beats airport parking just next door by $30.00 for the same two week period and your hotel is basically free.

Reviews.Title: “Andy”
Reviews.Author: Safia786
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on an overnighter, and it was nice and clean. But best of all was Andy at the front desk! He was very friendly and helpful and we would definately stay there again because of him:) Also love the free shuttle service to and from the airport as well as the free WIFI:)

Reviews.Title: “Beware of staying ay Phoenix Howard Johnson”
Reviews.Author: Eric L
Reviews.Content: We had a recent stay at the Howard Johnson Motel by the Pheonix airport, left our car there for 2 weeks while we were away. This was part of their Park and Fly program. What a mistake!!! When we returned our car had been vandalized. The catalytic converter was sawed completely off and stolen. This car was parked fairly close to the reservation office. The car was damaged to the extent of $2,500.00. When informed of this occurence in their main parking area the motel refused to do anything. We would never stay there again or trust this organization.

Reviews.Title: “OK for a budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tinalynn320
Reviews.Content: This hotel was inexpensive ($200 for 3 nights). Breakfast was included (cereal, bagels, fruit and waffle maker) Drinks were served in DIXIE cups, which was a little strange. It was close to the airport but about at $15 cab ride to downtown. I tried using the light rail and bus system in the city but it was somewhat confusing. When I went to check out the girl at the desk was clearly on a personal phone call. When I walked through the door to check out she said to the person on the phone, "Oh hang on a second I have a customer." She continued to talk to this person as I checked out and when I asked how I get to the airport shuttle, she walked me outside (while still on the phone with her friend) and said, "I am sorry I work and go to school.. (to the person on the phone)" and opened this door and said, "Have a nice day." That ended my stay...It was great having the shuttle to and from the airport but the pictures online defiantly made the place look waaaayyyyy nicer then it was. When I was heading downtown the cab driver told me that it was the, "rough part of town," Which totally made me feel better that I was staying there...The rooms themselves were OK. Comfortable beds, older TV's, Carpets had an odd smell. They did have a computer in the lobby that guests could use to print out boarding passes, etc. They charged $0.15 a piece of paper to print.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: MunroBill
Reviews.Content: I was able to get a room here, without a reservation, after one of the "Big Names" let me down. Very friendly and helpful staff, very comfortable and quiet. Courtesy service to the airport. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Goodnight stay, but we're left with damage to my truck using their park and fly program.””
Reviews.Author: tucsonsaints
Reviews.Content: We called ahead to see that we could take advantage of HoJo's airport park and fly program to save some money and time so we would not have to leave Tucson at 4am to make our flight. So we stayed the night of 2 July 2011 and later following week we returned from New York City late night after 8pm. It was getting dark so we just got into our truck, went to eat at Sonic, and then drove home to Tucson. We got home at 11:30pm parked the truck in the garage and didn't use our truck for 2 days only to find 3 different dents on the hood and a nice door dent on the side by the rear tire.. Our 2006 truck is white and I did see the dents at night. We thought we where going to save so money by using their park and fly program but should’ve just dropped our car at Phoenix airport. I've Called HoJO 3 different time’s and never received any callbacks from the staff about this issue.. SAD.. .

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe the pictures!!!!”
Reviews.Author: bigdoglvr
Reviews.Content: I booked this place on an employee rate and from the pictures from the website it looked so pretty and nice-NOT!! Was looking for a place close to the airport to just stay the night and fly back home with a nice pool for us to relax-this wasn't it. The pool was so dirty and tiny! The room smelled-the carpet was filthy and the bed spread had crumbs on it! Walked in and walked out within 10 minutes!! NOT GOOD!

Reviews.Title: “Good place and conveniently located”
Reviews.Author: d8889
Reviews.Content: On april 24 I checked in at the Howard Johnson on Van Buren Blvd since the following day I had to catch a flight from PHX. The place was neat, the rate good and breackfast in the morning was a real one. That's was a kind of surprise since almost any motel advertising continental breackfast in reality offers a meager meal . The position is simply perfect if you're headed to the airport and not far at all from Arizona State University

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to leave your jet lag behind”
Reviews.Author: TravelerKorendijk
Reviews.Content: We arrived from the Netherlands on April 6, following a 21-hour trip, and stayed three nights to climatize, pick up our rental car, and see something of Phoenix and its region. The manager in particular, and the staff in general were very helpful, and responded immediately and adequately when we had some questions. This is not the Beverly Hills Hotel of Hollywood, but it sure is an excellent place to stay if you want to be in the vicinity of the airport. It offers good service and fair value for money. We could recommend it to anyone. There is one point for attention: the breakfast was adequate, but during breakfast hours the staff should pay more attention and have a look from time to time to ensure that the place is kept clean and that all required items are available in sufficient supply.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: OregonCountry
Reviews.Content: For the price and with airport shuttle service, this hotel is a decent value. I can tell by speaking with the manager that he takes pride in the hotel, and wants to make sure the customers are content. The rooms are a little dated, but satisfactory. They are clean and nice sized. There is a swimming pool, I didn't use it though. Continental breakfast was average/good (they have a waffle maker! I like waffles.) If you want to go anywhere to eat, or see anything, you'll have to have a car, or ride the bus (#3 will take you straight downtown.)

Reviews.Title: “wow the best hotel”
Reviews.Author: bestdrinearth
Reviews.Content: I came of a business meeting from california, at night from the airport. They had a express shuttle to the hotel. Room was great and BIG... I was impress for location and the price. I recommend every one. If you are coming business or family vision.

HotelInfo.Name: Howard Johnson Airport Downtown
HotelInfo.Address: 4120 E. Van Buren, Phoenix, AZ 85008
